hanzi-su-wiki:
心

Значения

Сердце, душа; центр

🔑61

Мнемоника

  • Сердце. Линяя в центре — аорта. Точки — предсердие и два желудочка.

  • Изображение бьющегося сердца.

Описание

В современных словарях ключ со значением «сердце» встречается в двух вариантах, один из которых упрощенный 忄. Такое дублирование объясняется тем, что современные словари содержат не 214, а 227 ключей. Однако и официальный каталог, содержащий 214 ключей и опубликованный в 1716 году, при династии Цин (1644—1911), также содержит накладки и ошибки.

Сердце китайцы рассматривают как источник мысли и разума, оно по их понятиям является одним из пяти органов, ответственных за чувства, и управляется одним из пяти элементов — огнем.

Поместив за сердцем слово любовь, получаем «дорогой» или «возлюбленный». Иероглиф узник над сердцем заставляет переживать: это «сочувствие», «жалость». Если же заменить узника на раба, получим «страсть», пленяющую сердце. Аналогично иероглиф «психология» включает ключ сердце подразумевая, таким образом, «изучение правил сердца».

心爱 дорогой, возлюбленный
恩 жалость
怒 страсть
心理 психология

Похожие

必

心理 [ xīn lǐ ]: psychology; mentality

heisig_chinese_memo: I hung the heart of my victim with a hook and three drops of blood spattered me.
heisig_story: This character, a pictographic representation of the heart, is among the most widely used primitives we shall meet.
koohiiStory1: The four chambers in the heart. In the West, we point to our head when asked about the mind. In the East, they point to the heart. So then, the radical for "state of mind"…　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　RTK2:　シン　安心　あんしん(peace of mind).
koohiiStory2: Heart needs three drops of blood to work.
kunYomi: こころ、-ごころ、りっしんべん

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The radical heart and the kanji heart are the same. Rejoice and let your heart be free!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Also, make sure you know the radicals by heart, it'll help you to learn more effectively, just like with this kanji.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The heart, where is it stored in your body? Most people thought it was in the chest, but in reality, your heart is stored in your shin (しん).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: This is when I start kicking you in the shin and you imagine feeling the pain of getting kicked there. As I kick you in the shin, you grab your chest... all this stress is giving you a heart attack (though your shin hurts a ton too).
Ru_trainchinese:
xīn: (сущ) сердце; мысль, настроение; чувство; желание; душа, дух; сердцевина, центр
xīn: (ключ) сердце
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: I hung the heart of my victim with a hook and three drops of blood spattered me.
origin_of_ch_char_book: (心, xin=hsin, heart) It’s a heart and a blood vessel leading to the heart. Ancient people thought that people’s minds or emotions were born in the heart. Therefore, it is used as the meaning of ‘mind’.,(思, si=ssu, think) describes a head with a knot which has a complex thought (x). There is a heart which means emotions in below the character. The ancients believed that human emotions came from the heart, and complex and logical thoughts come from head. This character is a combination of thoughts and emotions that have mixed feelings of mind and soul. (愛, 爱, ai, love) A person stands tall, with his/her mouth widely opened , breathing long (like Yawning) with heart (心) in it, and with a foot down to the designated place (夊) below. It describes one’s mind heartily heads to one’s loved one.
humanum_full_description_en:
Although the shape of the golden seal character of the word " heart " has changed from simple to complex, the orientation of the image is very clear, and they all resemble the shape of the heart. The word "心" was misinterpreted as "贝" in the old oracle bone inscriptions. The two characters are different in shape. The bottom of the word "心" is connected while the word "贝" is separated. See " Bei ".

In the early days, the inscription on the inscription had the shape of a flap in the heart, or added a point in the hollow of the word for decoration. There is another word "悤" in the inscriptions on the " heart ", which is sometimes mixed. After the Spring and Autumn Period, the bottom pen of the word " heart " became longer and longer, which is the origin of the small seal.

The word " heart " in the oracle bone inscriptions can express the mind, such as "He Ji" 6928: "Wang Youxin (you) heart is Zheng (zheng)", which means that Wang Youxin wants to conquer. In addition, the word "心" can be used as " Qin " to refer to the name of water, such as "He Ji" 14022: "Hexin" refers to crossing the Qin Shui. "Said Wen": "Qin, the water flows out of Shangdang Yangtau Mountain, and enters the river in the southeast." According to Qinshui, it is in the southeast of Shanxi Province today.

" Heart " in the Bronze inscription refers to thoughts and thoughts, like a chime: "Don't (pi) show my imperial examination, but restrain the sacred heart (jue)." The whole sentence praises his great and distinguished father, who has bright thoughts. The ancients believed that love is born in the heart, and that human thinking is also dominated by the heart, "Mencius. "Gao Zi Shang" means: "The official of the heart thinks, thinks you get it, and if you don't think, you can't do it." Therefore, the ancients often used " heart " to express thoughts and feelings. "心" is also the Chinese character with the most word formation possible one.

"Shu Wen": "The heart, the human heart, the soil is hidden in the body. Pictogram. The doctor said that the fire is hidden. All the heart belongs to the heart." Xu Shen explained the five internal organs based on the five elements theory of modern and ancient texts. The ancient Scriptures are based on the heart, while the modern Scriptures are based on the fire.
humanum_short_description_en: " Heart " is the shape of the heart in the golden seal script.
humanum_full_description:
「心」字之甲金篆文字形雖由簡轉繁，但是其象物之取向甚明，皆象心之形。「心」字甲骨文舊誤釋為「貝」，二字字形有別，「心」字底部相連而「貝」字則分開。參見「貝」。

　　早期金文象心臟有膜瓣之形，或於字中空處加上一點作裝飾。金文中另有於「心」上別加一點的「悤」字，兩者時有相混。春秋以後，「心」字下尾筆漸長，乃小篆形體所本。

　　甲骨文「心」字可表示心思，如《合集》6928：「王㞢(有)心正(征)」，指王有心思要征伐。另「心」字可借用作「沁」，指水名，如《合集》14022：「涉心」，即指渡過沁水。《說文》：「沁，水出上黨羊頭山，東南入河。」按沁水在今山西省東南部。

　　金文中「心」指思想、心思，如逨編鐘：「不(丕)顯朕皇考，克粦明氒(厥)心。」全句讚頌其偉大顯赫的父親，擁有光明的思想。古人相信情生於心，人的思維亦由心臟主宰，《孟子．告子上》即云：「心之官則思，思則得之，不思則不得也。」因此古人多用「心」來表示思想感情，「心」也是漢字中構詞配搭可能最多的漢字之一。

　　《說文》：「心，人心，土藏，在身之中。象形。博士說以爲火藏。凡心之屬皆从心。」按許慎以今、古文經學的五行學說解釋五臟。古文經學以心屬土，今文經學則以心屬火。
humanum_short_description: 「心」字之甲金篆文象心臟之形。

heisig_comment:
* As a primitive, it can take three forms, to which we shall assign three distinct meanings.
In its kanji-form, it appears BENEATH or to the RIGHT of its relative primitive and means th physical organ of the heart.
To the LEFT, it is abbreviated to three strokes, ⺖, and means a wildly emotional state of mind.
And finally, at the very BOTTOM, it can take the form ⺗, in which case we give it the meaning of a valentine.

Chinese Definition:
Pictographic: A heart
①人和高等动物体内主管血液循环的器官(通称“心脏”)：心包。心律。心衰。心悸。
②中央，枢纽，主要的：心腹。中心。
③习惯上指思想的器官和思想情况，感情等：心理。心曲。心魄。心地。心扉。衷心。心旷神怡。人心惟危。
心理 [ xīn lǐ ]: psychology; mentality
心情 [ xīn qíng ]: mood; frame of mind; Classifiers: 个
Chinese Definition:
Pictographic: A heart
HSK: 3
Freq: 90
On-Yomi: シン
Kun-Yomi: こころ、-ごころ、りっしんべん
Heisig constituents: heart, drops, fishhook, heart
Heisig: This character, a pictographic representation of the heart, is among the most widely used primitives we shall meet.
* As a primitive, it can take three forms, to which we shall assign three distinct meanings.
In its kanji-form, it appears BENEATH or to the RIGHT of its relative primitive and means th physical organ of the heart.
To the LEFT, it is abbreviated to three strokes, ⺖, and means a wildly emotional state of mind.
And finally, at the very BOTTOM, it can take the form ⺗, in which case we give it the meaning of a valentine.
Chinese: I hung the heart of my victim with a hook and three drops of blood spattered me.

「 心 」字之甲金篆文字形雖由簡轉繁，但是其象物之取向甚明，皆象心之形。「 心 」字甲骨文舊誤釋為「 貝 」，二字字形有別，「 心 」字底部相連而「 貝 」字則分開。參見「 貝 」。 早期金文象心臟有膜瓣之形，或於字中空處加上一點作裝飾。金文中另有於「 心 」上別加一點的「 悤 」字，兩者時有相混。春秋以後，「 心 」字下尾筆漸長，乃小篆形體所本。 甲骨文「 心 」字可表示心思，如《合集》6928：「王㞢(有)心正(征)」，指王有心思要征伐。另「 心 」字可借用作「 沁 」，指水名，如《合集》14022：「涉心」，即指渡過沁水。《說文》：「沁，水出上黨羊頭山，東南入河。」按沁水在今山西省東南部。 金文中「 心 」指思想、心思，如逨編鐘：「不(丕)顯朕皇考，克粦明氒(厥)心。」全句讚頌其偉大顯赫的父親，擁有光明的思想。古人相信情生於心，人的思維亦由心臟主宰，《孟子．告子上》即云：「心之官則思，思則得之，不思則不得也。」因此古人多用「 心 」來表示思想感情，「 心 」也是漢字中構詞配搭可能最多的漢字之一。 《說文》：「心，人心，土藏，在身之中。象形。博士說以爲火藏。凡心之屬皆从心。」按許慎以今、古文經學的五行學說解釋五臟。古文經學以心屬土，今文經學則以心屬火。
Although the shape of the golden seal character of the word " heart" has changed from simple to complex, the orientation of the image is very clear, and they all resemble the shape of the heart. The word " 心" was misinterpreted as " 贝" in the old oracle bone inscriptions. The two characters are different in shape. The bottom of the word " 心" is connected while the word " 贝" is separated. See " Bei". In the early days, the inscription on the inscription had the shape of a flap in the heart, or added a point in the hollow of the word for decoration. There is another word " 悤" in the inscriptions on the " heart", which is sometimes mixed. After the Spring and Autumn Period, the bottom pen of the word " heart" became longer and longer, which is the origin of the small seal. The word " heart" in the oracle bone inscriptions can express the mind, such as "He Ji" 6928: "Wang Youxin (you) heart is Zheng (zheng)", which means that Wang Youxin wants to conquer. In addition, the word " 心" can be used as " Qin" to refer to the name of water, such as "He Ji" 14022: "Hexin" refers to crossing the Qin Shui. "Said Wen": "Qin, the water flows out of Shangdang Yangtau Mountain, and enters the river in the southeast." According to Qinshui, it is in the southeast of Shanxi Province today. " Heart" in the Bronze inscription refers to thoughts and thoughts, like a chime: "Don't (pi) show my imperial examination, but restrain the sacred heart (jue)." The whole sentence praises his great and distinguished father, who has bright thoughts. The ancients believed that love is born in the heart, and that human thinking is also dominated by the heart, "Mencius. "Gao Zi Shang" means: "The official of the heart thinks, thinks you get it, and if you don't think, you can't do it." Therefore, the ancients often used " heart" to express thoughts and feelings. " 心" is also the Chinese character with the most word formation possible one. "Shu Wen": "The heart, the human heart, the soil is hidden in the body. Pictogram. The doctor said that the fire is hidden. All the heart belongs to the heart." Xu Shen explained the five internal organs based on the five elements theory of modern and ancient texts. The ancient Scriptures are based on the heart, while the modern Scriptures are based on the fire.

心字的基本解释

心
xīn
人和高等动物体内主管血液循环的器官（通称“心脏”）：心包。心律。心衰。心悸。
中央，枢纽，主要的：心腹。中心。
习惯上指思想的器官和思想情况，感情等：心理。心曲。心魄。心地。心扉。衷心。心旷神怡。人心惟危。
口

心字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xīn］
［《廣韻》息林切，平侵，心。］
(1)心脏。人和脊椎动物体内推动血液循环的肌性器官。
(2)心脏所在的部位。泛指胸部。
(3)指胃部。
(4)古人以心为思维器官，故后沿用为脑的代称。
(5)思想、意念、感情的通称。
(6)挂怀，关心。
(7)本性；性情。
(8)思虑；谋划。
(9)中心，中央。
(10)指木上的尖刺、花蕊或草木的芽尖等。
(11)指某些点心的馅子。如包子心，饺子心。参见“心子”。
(12)我国古代哲学名词。指人的主观意识。与“物”相对。唯心主义哲学家认为“心”是世界的本体。
(13)唯物主义哲学家则认为“心”离不开“物”，有“物”才有“心”，无“物”即无“心”。
(14)佛教语。与“色”相对。佛教把一切精神现象称为“心”，有“三界唯心”之说。
(15)星名。二十八宿之一，东方苍龙七宿的第五宿，有星三颗。

心字的英文翻译

heart, center, feeling, intention

心字的康熙字典解释

【卯集上】【心字部】　心； 康熙笔画：4； 页码：页375第01
【唐韻】息林切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】思林切。【說文】人心，土藏，在身之中。象形。博士說以爲火藏。【徐曰】心爲大火，然則心屬火也。【玉篇】【廣韻】?訓火藏。　又【荀子·解蔽篇】心者，形之君也，而神明之主也。【禮·大學疏】總包萬慮謂之心。　又【釋名】心，纖也。所識纖微無不貫也。　又本也。【易·復卦】復其見天地之心乎。【註】天地以本爲心者也。【正義曰】言天地寂然不動，是以本爲心者也。【禮·禮器】如松柏之有心也。【註】得氣之本也。【孔疏】得氣之本，故巡四時，柯葉無凋攺也，心謂本也。　又中也。心在身之中。【詩序】情動于中。【正義曰】中謂中心。凡言中央曰心。【禮·少儀】牛羊之肺，離而不提心。【註】不提心，謂不絕中央也。【古歌】日出當心，謂日中也。【邵雍淸夜吟】月到天心處，言月當天中也。　又東方五度，宿名。【史記·天官書】心爲明堂。　又【禮·明堂位】夏后氏祭心。【註】氣主盛也。又【月令】季夏祭先心。【註】五藏之次，心次肺，至此則心爲尊也。　又去聲。【吳棫·韻補

心字的起名意思

：指心意、心思、内部、中心等。

heart
Basic explanation of words
heart
xīn
The organ responsible for blood circulation in humans and higher animals (commonly known as the "heart"): the pericardium. Heart rhythm. Heart failure. Palpitations.
Central, hub, main: confidant. center.
It is customary to refer to the organs of thoughts and mental conditions, feelings, etc.: psychology. Heart song. Soul-stirring. Heart. Heart. heartfelt. Refreshing and happy. People's hearts are at stake.
mouth
heart
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xīn］
["Guangyun" Xilinqie, flat invasion, heart. ]
(1) Heart. The muscular organs in humans and vertebrates that promote blood circulation.
(2) The location of the heart. Refers to the chest in general.
(3) Refers to the stomach.
(4) The ancients used the heart as the organ of thinking, so it was later used as a synonym for brain.
(5) General term for thoughts, ideas, and feelings.
(6) Caring and caring.
(7) Nature; temperament.
(8) Thinking; planning.
(9) Center, center.
(10) Refers to the spikes, stamens, or bud tips of plants and trees on wood.
(11) Refers to the fillings of certain snacks. Such as steamed bun heart, dumpling heart. See "heart son".
(12) Ancient Chinese philosophical terms. Refers to the subjective consciousness of people. Contrast with "things". Idealist philosophers believe that the "heart" is the noumenon of the world.
(13) Materialist philosophers believe that the "heart" cannot be separated from the "thing". Only when there is a "thing" can there be a "heart", and without a "thing", there is no "heart".
(14) Buddhist language. Contrast with "color". Buddhism refers to all spiritual phenomena as the "heart", which is called the "Three Realms Idealism".
(15) Star name. One of the twenty-eight places, the fifth place of the seven places of the Eastern Canglong, has three stars.

сердце
xīn
1) анат. сердце; сердечный
巨大心 мед. бычье (гипертрофированное) сердце
强心剂 мед. сердечное (укрепляющее) средство
2) сердце; душа, дух; всем сердцем, всей душой; сердечный; душевный; искренний
邪 (xié) 了心了 покривил душой
心深处 в глубине сердца
心辞 сердечные слова
心瞿(惧) сердце страхом трепещет
3) грудь; грудная полость
隐于心中 таить в груди
西施病心 у Си-ши болело в груди
4) ум, разум, интеллект, рассудок; мысль
心很灵 у него живой ум
5) желания; настроения; намерения

6) воля, решимость; устремлённость
有心人 целеустремлённый человек
7) центр, середина; сердцевина; сердечник
地心 центр земли
江心 середина реки
果心 сердцевина плода
铅心 свинцовый сердечник
灯心 фитиль лампы
8) * колючка, шип (дерева)
其于木也, 为坚多心 это дерево среди прочих отличается твёрдостью и множеством колючек

心

Значения

Сердце, душа; центр

🔑61

Мнемоника

  • Сердце. Линяя в центре — аорта. Точки — предсердие и два желудочка.

  • Изображение бьющегося сердца.

Описание

В современных словарях ключ со значением «сердце» встречается в двух вариантах, один из которых упрощенный 忄. Такое дублирование объясняется тем, что современные словари содержат не 214, а 227 ключей. Однако и официальный каталог, содержащий 214 ключей и опубликованный в 1716 году, при династии Цин (1644—1911), также содержит накладки и ошибки.

Сердце китайцы рассматривают как источник мысли и разума, оно по их понятиям является одним из пяти органов, ответственных за чувства, и управляется одним из пяти элементов — огнем.

Поместив за сердцем слово любовь, получаем «дорогой» или «возлюбленный». Иероглиф узник над сердцем заставляет переживать: это «сочувствие», «жалость». Если же заменить узника на раба, получим «страсть», пленяющую сердце. Аналогично иероглиф «психология» включает ключ сердце подразумевая, таким образом, «изучение правил сердца».

Radicals: 心  (heart)
Meaning Mnemonic
The radical heart and the kanji heart are the same. Rejoice and let your heart be free!
Also, make sure you know the radicals by heart, it'll help you to learn more effectively, just like with this kanji.
Reading Mnemonic
The heart, where is it stored in your body? Most people thought it was in the chest, but in reality, your heart is stored in your shin (しん).
This is when I start kicking you in the shin and you imagine feeling the pain of getting kicked there. As I kick you in the shin, you grab your chest... all this stress is giving you a heart attack (though your shin hurts a ton too).
